title: Stocks Slightly Higher Despite Report Casting Doubt on China Trade Talks
text:
The three major U.S. stock market indexes were headed toward a lower open on Thursday after the White House denied a report that Chinese Vice Premier Liu He would leave Washington, D.C. after spending just one day in high-level trade negotiations. However, stocks turned marginally positive in early morning trading.

The South China Morning Post reported that Liu would leave the capitol on Thursday. With trade talks set to begin between the U.S. and China on Thursday, if Liu departed today, it would mean that there would only...
description: Futures of the three major U.S. stock market indexes were in the red on Thursday after the White House denied a report that Chinese Vice Premier Liu He would leave Washington, D.C. after just one day of negotiations. But stocks turned marginally positive in early morning trading.
